comment.author: 20958381@N08
comment._content: Interestingly, by 1910, the Grosvenor had grown to take up the entire half of the block on which it stood. So the first image would certainly date to or before 1910 as we can see that the Grosvenor is still relatively small (I would think its possible that it might even date to around that date - maybe we could all have a go at it!). Now, on a map I've seen dated to 1910 (think it's from SRNSW?), the rest of the block was supposedly taken up by Mann's Family Hotel.  From the1927 image above it doesn't seem like this was one building but maybe all the buildings on that half of the block formed parts of the Mann's Family Hotel. Clearly I need to do more research :-/

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/agrippinamaior] If you can get a firm date for this via the hotels, that would be good.  

It is one of several photos of buildings in Kent St which show "vignetting" at the corners, unlike most of the plague photos (c.1900).  Maybe earlier c.1888, and to do with building damage caused by the building of the Kent St sewer.  See notes and comments here (also a work in recent progress) - 

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/3863105457/]

comment.author: 20958381@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Hmmm interesting! It's so debilitating not having my hands readily on a copy of Sands!

comment.author: 20958381@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] So, as a start: on closer inspection, there is a walkway next to the Grosvenor, meaning building works are occurring. Now according to Trove the hotel opened in 1888. It was renovated in 1904. So possibly the image does date to its construction in 1888 or its 1904 renovation. More investigation underway!

comment.author: 20958381@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] The only Trove results so far in SMH for James Family Hotel are 1886, 1887, 1888. Correction. Have found results for James Family Hotel in SMH from 1882 to 1888. I really need to look at Sands!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/agrippinamaior] Great stuff! It's looking a lot like c.1888 for this series.
